definition: the not-very-distant past/modern times, excluding recent decades/(in the context of Chinese history) the period from the Opium Wars until the May 4th Movement (mid-19th century to 1919)/capitalist times (pre-1949)
near/close to/approximately
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
modern history (for China, from the Opium Wars until the fall of the Qing Dynasty, i.e. mid-19th to early 20th century)

sentences.english: Modern English empiricists take experience and natural as two opposed conceptions.
sentences.chinese: 英国近代经验论者，将经验和自然对立起来。

sentences.english: Shanghai was one of the first five treaty ports in modern China.
sentences.chinese: 作为近代中国最早的五个通商口岸之一的上海。

sentences.english: Recent history has witnessed the exciting politicization of meat.
sentences.chinese: 近代历史见证了肉食品的政治化。

sentences.english: In former times the typical "royal" horse shoe shapes have been built to serve the needs of the political surrounding.
sentences.chinese: 近代所流行的马蹄型就是为了适应政治氛围的需求。

sentences.english: Therefore, neoteric peasant movements are the major impetus of Chinas earlier modernization.
sentences.chinese: 因此，近代农民运动是中国早期现代化的主要推动力。

sentences.english: The principle of orality is established as a basic principle in modern civil Procedural law.
sentences.chinese: 言词原则是近代民事诉讼法确立的一项重要原则。

sentences.english: A study by the technique of modern physics has been made on the interaction between chemical materials and biomembrane.
sentences.chinese: 用近代物理技术对药物与生物膜相互作用进行了研究。

sentences.english: Prof, Zhu Kezhcn is both a pioneer and a founder of modern geography in China.
sentences.chinese: 竺可桢教授是中国近代科学地理学的先驱与奠基人。

sentences.english: This paper deals with the study on the city historical transformation of modern Pudong district.
sentences.chinese: 本文以近代浦东城区历史变迁为研究对象。

sentences.english: The colour index of metallic minerals is making new progress in quantitative determination of modern mineralography.
sentences.chinese: 金属矿物颜色指数是近代矿相学中定量测定的新进展。

sentences.english: Besides, he directed full attention to the training of people with Western learning.
sentences.chinese: 除了兴办近代工业外，容闳还十分注重培养西学人才。

sentences.english: Was a typical modern spin vegetarian bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 点石斋是近代较为典型的书局。

sentences.english: Thus, to enable the emergence of modern pre-school education, with the objective needs.
sentences.chinese: 这样，就使近代学前教育的产生，有了客观的需要。

sentences.english: Western modern sericulture was introduced into China in the late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 西方近代化蚕学理论和养蚕技术于晚清传入中国。

sentences.english: However, both Chinese nation spirits and Chinese contemporary literature have transitionary limitations.
sentences.chinese: 近代中华民族精神和中国近代文学都有过渡性的局限。

sentences.english: However, both Chinese nation spirits and Chinese contemporary literature have transitionary limitations.
sentences.chinese: 近代中华民族精神和中国近代文学都有过渡性的局限。

definition: the final years of the Ch'ing or Qing dynasty/China at the turn of the 20th century
the late Qing/late 19th and early 20th century China
the late Qing and early Republic, i.e. China around 1911
the first half (of a period)
20th century
modern history (for China, from the Opium Wars until the fall of the Qing Dynasty, i.e. mid-19th to early 20th century)
late Ming/first half of the 17th century
late Ming and early Qing/around the middle of the 17th century
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
the Opium Wars of 1840-1842 and 1860-1861
ancient times/olden times
Xinhai Revolution (1911), which ended the Qing Dynasty
Republic of China (1912-1949)/used in Taiwan as the name of the calendar era (e.g. 民國六十年|民国六十年 is 1971, the 60th year after 1911)
the Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
